Experience Business Data Analyst Google January 2015  – Present (7 months) Dublin (20% Role in Addition to Core Account Strategy Role.) 
 
Lead several projects to automate the previously labour intensive creation of reports and insights. 
 
I've built several data driven dashboards that provide insights into the cases our team take on as well as our impact on revenue and customer success. Both at a team level and scaled out across EMEA. 
 
I've designed and managed the data pipelines and have presented the insights from this analysis both in videos I've created and at presentations to our team and managers. Experience Associate Product Manager - Google Fit Google August 2014  – Present (1 year) Mountain View, California I am the product manager for the Google Fit app. 
 
My recent responsibilities include: 
+ Leading the app through its initial launch, in the process defining our mission, strategy, minimum viable product and responding to internal feedback to get us to a launch-ready state.  
+ Leading prioritization efforts, establishing product vision and roadmaps and driving decision-making across leadership, engineering, design, marketing, PR, legal and release teams through multiple product iterations on our mobile/tablet Android applications, Android Wear application and web offering.  
+ Growing the app from initial launch to over 7 million users in 6 months. 
 
Latest official blog post for the app: http://officialandroid.blogspot.com/2015/05/google-fit-make-every-step-count.html Associate Product Manager - Google Flight Search Google September 2013  –  August 2014  (1 year) Zurich Product manager for the Google Flights frontend.  
 
My responsibilities included:  
+ Leading prioritization efforts, establishing product vision and roadmaps and drove decision-making across leadership, engineering, design, marketing, PR, legal and release teams through multiple product iterations on google.com/flights. 
 
Top launches include the following: 
+ Providing users with tips on how to change their flight to get a lower price and/or better experience 
+ Allowing users to save flights and share them with their travel partners 
+ Putting flight prices right into our date selector so users can be price-conscious from the start 
+ Working through technical constraints to develop a travel exploration feature where a user can get flight prices from their origin to top cities around the world 
+ Grouping flights results in commuter markets (e.g. LA -> NYC) for easier viewing, similar to transit schedules (also received patent for the UI) 
+ Launching the product in 20+ new languages and introducing currency selection for international users 
+ Evangelizing and representing the product both within the company as well as outside conferences and events such as being a keynote speaking at the Travel Executive Forum 
+ Revamping our PR and marketing efforts 
+ Actively recruiting for the Google, participating as a panelist at several external events and giving presentations at universities

Summary Rupin Pahwa is someone who is constantly questioning the status-quo, challenging himself and people around him to do more. He believes that life should be a continuous pursuit of learning, growing and excelling.  
 
He has spent the last 3 and half years working in Google in various capacities.  
He has worked on SMB & Consumer Marketing Projects covering a wide variety of products and services under the Google Product Portfolio. 
 
He is an Online Search and Display Marketing Expert with extensive knowledge of Google AdWords, Facebook Marketing, etc. 
 
He has worked with clients in Australia, New Zealand, North America, Germany, Russia, India and other South Asian Countries like Indonesia and Singapore in different capacities as an Ad Policy Expert, AdWords Specialist.  
 
He has also worked with the Youtube team and has helped hundreds of musicians in understanding the YT Partner Program. 
 
During his stint, he won numerous peer bonuses (as a token of appreciation from his colleagues for going above and beyond in delivering exceptional results), a Platinum award in his first quarter, followed by a Gold award in his second year. 
 
He has also worked with Audi Gurgaon as a Customer Relationship Manager prior to Google 
 
He holds a Dual Specialization MBA degree (Marketing Major) and he was awarded the 'Best All Round Student (Best Manager) at the Amity University Convocation.  
 
He believes that a healthy mind resides in a healthy body and swears by Tae;kwan-do, Karate, Kick boxing and other Martial arts techniques to keep oneself fit. 
He loves Rock Climbing, Swimming as physical sports 
 
Outside work, he is passionate about Music - knows how to play 7 instruments and is a respected Singer-Songwriter in the Delhi Music Circuit. 
He won the prestigious India KWC Finale 2013 and represented India at the KWC Finals in Laapeenranta, Finland. 
He is also a trained Indian Classical Vocalist She will be Loved/Tum Hi Ho - Mashup Edit Summary Rupin Pahwa is someone who is constantly questioning the status-quo, challenging himself and people around him to do more. GIBO - Get India Business Online  
 
Having worked in Q1’11, well aware of the global programs GAGA and GXBO, I handled Operations, acting as an Event Coordinator for the ‘Get India Business Online’ mega-event. 
I also acted as a liaison between Host-gator (our partner for website creation) and our customers. 
 
Google Doodle 
 
Worked with the Doodle cannon team and Product Marketing Managers to decide Doodles for Google India in Q1 and Q2’11. SMB Marketing Project Manager Google January 2011  –  March 2011  (3 months) Gurgaon, India SMB Marketing  
1) Worked with the External TeleSales Operations team ,on driving better acquisitions from tier 7-9 clients. Helped streamline the process, identify industries showing interest in online marketing, better verticalization leading to better optimization, resulting in higher customer satisfaction and thus more referrals. 
 
2) Worked on Google Places with HotPot promotion - I conducted the 'Hotpot Jackpot' contest; created/managed a website; designed creatives; ran a poster campaign; conceived, created and edited the hotpot internal promotion video and organized and managed special TGIFs across all offices.  
3) Improved the SMB Presentation (Silent Salesman) sent to our SMB customers by the sales team at the call centres by introducing new concepts, explaining the product better and illustrating impressions, clicks and conversions. 
 
4) Together with Kushagra, came up with 'Business in a box' package (initial stages for GIBO) to provide bunch of services to SMB including Google Places, Google Checkout etc. to holistically satisfy the customer's needs. 
 
5) Conducted trainings at vCustomer 
 
(I) For Sales Agents 
a) approach clients w/ Vartika Narain, 
b) address customer issues regarding billing & payments, 
c) pitch for higher acquisition amount. 
d) communication with Marketing about targeting 
e) Online verticalization training 
 
(II) For GAP process improvements - preparing the clients to manage the accounts after the Jumpstart period (initial 30 days) 
 
(III) For Quality team at vCustomer 
a) Emphasis on flexibility of approach, product knowledge, modifying approach according to client profiling and needs. 
b) Clarification on Global Vertical Taxonomy 
 
6) I researched and examined key potential areas in SMBs and submitted two ideas for promotion - SMB Support (helping clients with good potential and solid business plan) and Easy Website Builder (to have an easier Presentation-like-interface to build websites) now under GIBO. Summary Business professional with a varied skill set across marketing and sales. Proven track record of excelling in a fast-paced and results-oriented environment, coupled with the ability to jump seamlessly between analytical/creative marketing responsibilities and consultative sales functions. Passion for creating positive in the world through my talents, energy, and work ethic. 
 
Past: Cut my teeth from 2010 to 2013 on search, display, and video executions for Google's biggest clients - most notably in the spaces of e-commerce and omni-channel retailing. Moved to London in 2013 to work on Finance brands as they figured out branded video content on YouTube.  
 
Present: Came back stateside and moved into the prestigious APMM program, learning the client side of the business across creative, growth, and product. Focused on the launch and development of Google's gTLD strings, as well as the day-to-day management of the company's domain portfolio. Since then, I've become one of the first marketers on Google Domains, touching every aspect of the marketing mix for the new business. Moved to Google Maps marketing in April of 2015, managing all social channels as well as working on traditional product marketing.  
 
When I'm not @ the Googleplex, some consider me one of the country's most promising young magicians. I perform for an array of prestigious clients nationwide under my stage name of David Gerard. I write, direct, and produce a one-man show that has sold out for over 4 years straight in the Bay Area.

Business BBA,  Management and Human Resources ,  International Business ,  Spanish Linguistics 2007  – 2012 Artur graduated from UW Madison with a triple major in Management and Human Resources, International Business and Spanish Linguistics. He can't imagine a better university than Madison. 
 
Beyond his core classwork, Artur enjoyed taking foreign language classes, including French and Mandarin, along with fun PhysEd classes like Fencing, Bowling, Tennis and more. 
 
Outside of class Artur was heavily involved with UW Rotaract during his entire time at UW Madison. He served in a variety of roles at the organization, including as co-President for one year. 
 
He also participated in the Research Scholars Program for two years as a Scholar supporting the research of faculty, and for two years as a Fellow teaching a weekly seminar. The program was Artur's most formative experience in college, thanks to its unique approach to academia and incredible advisors, faculty, colleagues and students. Activities and Societies:  UW Rotaract/International Business Students Association (co-President) ,  Undergraduate Research Scholars Program Universidad Complutense de Madrid Study Abroad,  Spanish Language and Literature ,  International Business 2009  – 2010 Artur attended the Universidad Complutense de Madrid for a full academic year. During his time there he enrolled in 2 full semesters of Business Management and Spanish Linguistics classes, all of them taught in Spanish and targeted to local native speakers.  
 
While overwhelming at first, the high language and social bar had an enormous developmental impact in his Spanish fluency and in his integration into Spanish culture. 
 
Outside of school Artur shared an apartment with Spanish students. He enjoyed exploring and experiencing everything Madrid has to offer, and meeting students and professionals from all over the world. A regular client for Ryan Air, Artur made the most of his time in Spain by visiting 16 different Spanish cities and 8 additional countries. 
 
In the end, though, he still prefers Barcelona.
